thread.title: Emerson Hyndman joins Rangers FC on loan
thread.title_full: Emerson Hyndman joins Rangers FC on loan

title: Emerson Hyndman joins Rangers FC on loan
text:
Emerson Hyndman joins Rangers FC on loan Featured 0 Jan 9, 2017 11:48:58 AM The American international will spend the remainder of the season on loan with the Scottish giants. 
Rangers FC has announced the loan signing of Emerson Hyndman from AFC Bournemouth until the end of the 2016-17 season. 
The 20-year-old American midfielder had struggled to find playing time with the Cherries after a preseason injury hampered his progress. 
Sources: LA Galaxy lining up serious bid for Jonathan dos Santos​ 
Hyndman has played just three times for the Bournemouth senior side in 2016-17, including two appearances in the EFL Cup and one game in the FA Cup. He has yet to make a matchday squad for a Premier League game. . @RangersFC can today confirm the signing of @EmersonHyndman from @AFCBournemouth on a six month loan deal: https://t.co/XDz1uqQWXQ pic.twitter.com/OQ2gfKS12f — Rangers FC (@RangersFC) January 9, 2017 
Hyndman joined Bournemouth in the offseason after his contract with Fulham expired. The Texas native signed with the London outfit in 2011 at the age of 15 before breaking into the senior team at age 18. 
Internationally, Hyndman has represented the U.S. at various youth levels, and has been capped three times by the senior national team.
